title: CorTalk: Before Mood Improves: How Antidepressants Act on the Brain
description: Antidepressants often take weeks to improve mood â€” but their effects on the brain begin much earlier. Prof. Catherine Harmer explains how drug treatments rapidly alter emotional processing and cognition, reshaping how patients perceive the world. This work challenges traditional views of antidepressant action and offers new pathways for predicting who will and won't benefit from them.
